q_en: Have all the sewing tasks for the orders placed by the Hong Kong Polytechnic University in January been completed?

steps.sql: SELECT id FROM customers WHERE customer_name = 'PolyU';
steps.description: Retrieve the customer ID for the customer with the name "PolyU"

steps.sql: SELECT id FROM orders WHERE user_id = '1' AND created_at BETWEEN '2024-01-01' AND '2024-01-31';
steps.description: Retrieve the order IDs for orders placed by the customer "PolyU" in January

steps.sql: SELECT id FROM order_product WHERE order_id IN (1);
steps.description: Retrieve the order product IDs for the orders placed by "PolyU" in January

steps.sql: SELECT status FROM sewing_tasks WHERE order_product_id IN (1, 2, 3, 4, 5);
steps.description: Check the status of sewing tasks for the retrieved order products

steps.sql: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM sewing_tasks WHERE order_product_id IN (1, 2, 3, 4, 5) AND status != 2;
steps.description: Determine if all sewing tasks are completed (status = 2)

response:
Hello there! üòÑ Let's dive into the details of the sewing tasks for the orders placed by PolyU in January.

Here's a summary of the sewing task statuses:

| Order Product ID | Sewing Task Status |
|------------------|--------------------|
| 1                | Completed (2)      |
| 2                | In Progress (1)    |
| 3                | In Progress (1)    |
| 4                | In Progress (1)    |
| 5                | In Progress (1)    |

From the table, we can see that not all sewing tasks have been completed. Only one task is marked as completed, while the others are still in progress. So, it looks like there's still some work to be done! üßµ‚úÇÔ∏è
